items.title: Australian professor Richard Robson among Nobel Prize chemistry winners
items.summary: The discovery for the Nobel chemistry prize has been likened to a Harry Potter enchanted handbag.

items.title: 'Deeply harmful': Autism advocates fear major change for some Australian children
items.summary: The government is pushing ahead with a new program — and there are concerns it could leave some children falling between the cracks.

items.title: There's a difference between hot and cold sweat — and one tends to smell more distinctive
items.summary: Cold sweat is known as psychological sweat, while hot sweat is often the body's response to physical exertion.

items.title: Australia's cancer survival rates are improving — but there are also some 'concerning' trends
items.summary: Australia's latest snapshot of cancer incidence and deaths has been released.

items.title: Home Affairs knew for months 'ISIS brides' were returning; granted children citizenship
items.summary: The federal government says the group, who arrived in Australia recently, are being monitored.

items.title: Senior US officials arrive in Egypt for Gaza peace talks as Israeli assault dials down
items.summary: Donald Trump said a deal was "very close" and that he may travel to the Middle East this weekend.

items.title: Former FBI chief James Comey pleads not guilty in case pushed by Trump
items.summary: Donald Trump has threatened to imprison his political rivals since the start of his 2016 presidential campaign.

items.title: Optus sent triple-zero outage notification to the wrong email address, department says
items.summary: Companies had been told "a number of times" the email address was not to be used for notifications, a departmental staffer said.

items.title: Australian flotilla activist accuses government of 'shameful' Israel extraction effort
items.summary: Australians were detained at what has been called an "outrageous" prison.

items.title: Missed the harvest moon? Here's when to see the next supermoons
items.summary: The year's first supermoon happened on Tuesday night but don't worry, there are more on the way.

items.title: Judge references deadly crowd crush as Opera House rally decision nears
items.summary: The judge also said a major city route could turn into a "narrow funnel", as organisers insist it can be done safely.

items.title: 'State sponsors of terrorism' to be brought into Criminal Code
items.summary: New laws will target state entities that "fuel division, create fear and erode social cohesion" in Australia, the government said.

items.title: Fears over 'traumatising' home visits after minister flags disability system changes
items.summary: Disability advocates are demanding clarity on upcoming NDIS changes, warning that the new system could be "traumatising".

items.title: 'They're on notice': New AFP boss' warning to Australia's adversaries
items.summary: Krissy Barrett, the first woman to lead the Australian Federal Police, has revealed some of her early moves in her new role.

items.title: Kneecap member vows to fight and win again as prosecutors appeal terrorism charge
items.summary: UK prosecutors will appeal a court's decision to throw out a terrorism case against a member of the Irish rap trio.

items.title: Australians from Gaza aid flotilla deported by Israel to Jordan following detention
items.summary: Some of the Australian activists recently detained by Israel have alleged violence and mistreatment at the hands of soldiers.

items.title: 'The purpose of my voice is to teach history': Survivor tells how a party turned to trauma
items.summary: Nova Festival attack survivor Natalie Sanandaji shares her ordeal escaping the massacre on 7 October 2023 in southern Israel.

items.title: Federal government admits handballing truth-telling process as only 'half a person' employed
items.summary: The Greens have questioned what progress is being made on truth-telling and treaty at a federal level.

items.title: 'You are not alone': PM and Ley recall horrors of Hamas attack, commemorating October 7
items.summary: Both major party leaders have stood in solidarity with Australia's Jewish community as it remembers the Hamas-led attack on Israel.

items.title: In pictures: Israel marks October 7 anniversary
items.summary: Bereaved friends and family members gathered at the site of the Nova music festival, while others came together in Tel Aviv and held ceremonies across the country.

items.title: 'Fighting a war on two fronts': Behind the rise of a new threat in Gaza
items.summary: Newly released data shows a major spike in intra-Palestinian violent incidents this year, as well as a significant rise in stolen aid packages.

items.title: Amongst national failures on Closing the Gap, local programs are seeing success
items.summary: Australia’s Closing the Gap targets remain largely unmet, but communities like Yarrabah are proving that empowerment, not policy, is what truly drives change.

items.title: University students panicked after fraudulent emails 'revoked', 'disqualified' degrees
items.summary: Western Sydney University said the emails are "not legitimate" and have been reported to police.

items.title: Few women, minorities win seats in Syria's parliamentary election, initial results show
items.summary: One of the election observers described the new parliament as overwhelmingly Sunni Muslim and male.
